contentrichtext.text: {{no footnotes|date=February 2013}} [[Image:Deucher.gif|thumb|right|Adolf Deucher]] '''Adolf Deucher''' (15 February 1831, [[Wipkingen]] – 10 July 1912, [[Bern]]) was a [[Switzerland|Swiss]] politician. He was elected to the [[Swiss Federal Council]] on 10 April 1883 and died in office on 10 July 1912. He was affiliated to the [[Free Democratic Party of Switzerland|Free Democratic Party]]. During his office time he held the following departments: *[[Department of Justice and Police]] (1883) *[[Department of Posts and Railways]] (1884) *[[Department of Home Affairs (Switzerland)|Department of Home Affairs]] (1885) *[[Political Department]] (1886) *[[Federal Department of Economic Affairs|Department of Trade and Agriculture]] (1887) *[[Federal Department of Economic Affairs|Department of Industry and Agriculture]] (1888–1895) *[[Federal Department of Economic Affairs|Department of Trade, Industry and Agriculture]] (1896) *[[Political Department]] (1897) *[[Federal Department of Economic Affairs|Department of Trade, Industry and Agriculture]] (1898–1902) *[[Political Department]] (1903) *[[Federal Department of Economic Affairs|Department of Trade, Industry and Agriculture]] (1904–1908) *[[Political Department]] (1909) *[[Federal Department of Economic Affairs|Department of Trade, Industry and Agriculture]] (1910–1912) He was [[President of the Confederation (Switzerland)|President of the Confederation]] four times in 1886, 1897, 1903 and 1909. ==External links== *{{HDS|4056}} *{{DNB portal|119410826|TYP=}} *{{Swiss Federal Councillor|31}}
